Dallas Mavericks Suite Prices and Details

How much do Dallas Mavericks suites cost?

Dallas Mavericks luxury suites typically cost between $3,000-$10,000 per game, depending on team performance, opponent, and day of the week. Midweek games are priced at a premium as are games versus popular opponents like the Los Angeles Lakers, Milwaukee Bucks and the San Antonio Spurs.

How many guests can fit in a Mavericks suite?

Dallas Mavericks suites range in size and configuration. Flagship and Platinum Level suites have a capacity of 12-23. Most suites come with a base quantity of 18 tickets and the option to purchase overflow tickets, as needed. Suites on the Admiral Level commonly come with a quantity of 12 tickets.

Flagship Suite Details

Flagship suites are located on the lowest of 3 suite levels at American Airlines Center. Flagship suites include VIP parking passes, exclusive access to suite level bars and restaurants, and premium in-suite catering options. Most Flagship suites will accommodate 12 - 18 guests. Suite amenities include interior and exterior seating, HDTV's, and a wet bar.

Your Theater Box includes access to clubs as well as bars and restaurants at American Airlines Center. Theater Boxes also include food & beverage for Stars and Mavericks games.

Platinum Suite Details

The Platinum Suite Level are just above the Club Level located on the North end of American Airlines Center. Platinum Suites are right been the Flagship and Platinum Suites and are especially desirable for concerts giving you a direct view to the stage for most secondary events. Most Platinum suites will accommodate 12 -18 guests. There is indoor/outdoor seating in the suite with HDTVs and a full kitchenette.

American Airlines Center Event Planning Guide

Catering

All Dallas Mavericks luxury suites offer premium in-suite catering provided by Levy Restaurants. The catering menu at the American Airlines Center has many local options including the popular Dallas Smokehouse Package. For a Mavericks suite, most people spend around $100 per person.

×

Catering Details

Following the purchase of your suite, a representative from Suite Experience Group will provide you with the American Airlines Center advanced catering menu. Guests can also choose to forego pre-ordering catering and instead order food and beverages in their suite from a more limited event day menu. All advanced catering orders must be returned to your Suite Experience Group representative 5 business days prior to your event. If you are celebrating a birthday or another special event and would like to order a custom cake, please notify your Suite Experience Group representative and they will provide you with the American Airlines Center custom cake order form.

Parking and Transportation

VIP parking for Dallas Mavericks suite ticket holders is in the Lexus Garage adjacent to the arena. A physical or mobile pass is required for entry. The ride-sharing pick-up/drop-off point is located on Star Way and Olive St. Street parking is limited and public transportation is encouraged.

Budget

When renting a Dallas Mavericks suite, make sure to budget the suite rental cost, catering(optional) and any Mavericks gear or gifts you plan on buying. Mavericks suite rentals cost between $3,000-$10,000 on average. Catering is about $1,200-$1,800 but can be more or less based on your order.

Club Access

Included with a Mavericks suite is exclusive access to the Platinum (Club) Level at American Airlines Center. This includes the Lexus Platinum Club, Effen Vodka Lounge, and the BeachBound Lounge among others. Platinum Level features cash bars and lounge seating in addition to private restrooms.

Dress Code

There is no dress code for the suite levels at American Airlines Center. Corporate groups typically dress in business casual attire but shorts, jeans, hats or any Mavericks gear is perfectly fine. Comfortable shoes are also encouraged. Suites are climate-controlled with a closest for coat storage.

Venue Bag Policy

If you are attending a Mavericks game in a suite, all fans entering AAC are subject to metal detector screenings. Any bags larger then 14”x14”x6” are not allowed into the arena. Laptops and tablets are permitted inside the arena for Mavericks games. No outside food or drinks are allowed.

Entrances

There are three VIP entrances at the American Airlines Center: Northeast Platinum Entry (All Star Way across from Lexus Garage); Southeast Platinum Entry (between East Doors and Jack Daniel’s Club) and Gold Entry (Olive St.). All gates open 90 minutes before Dallas Mavericks games.

Child Ticket Policy

Children under the age of 2 do not require a separate admission ticket to enter American Airlines Center. Dallas Mavericks suites provide a safe private environment for families and groups with young children. Strollers are permitted and are able to be checked at Guest Relations inside AAC.

Frequently Asked Dallas Mavericks Questions

Will my Dallas Mavericks luxury suite be completely private to me and my group?

Yes, Suite Experience Group does not rent shared luxury suites. Your luxury suite will be completely private to you and your group.

Does my Dallas Mavericks luxury box include food and beverages?

Most Dallas Mavericks luxury boxes will not include food or beverages. Catering will be available for an additional cost and food and beverages can also be purchased day of the game in your luxury box from your suite attendant.

What other areas of American Airlines Center will my skybox ticket give me access too?

Your skybox ticket will give you access to the most exclusive spaces in American Airlines Center including, The Wine Press, The Breakaways, The Lexus Club Restaurant and Bars, El Taco Tex, and La Cucina.

Please view our Frequently Asked Questions or Contact Us.

He averaged a career-high 32.4 points last season while grabbing over eight rebounds and dishing out eight assists. Doncic is one of the most exciting, explosive, and reliable players in the league. If the Mavs go anywhere, it’ll be Doncic and Irving steering the ship.

American Airlines Center is the place to be for NBA viewing. The Osadia Tequila Club is an exclusive, semi-private seats sold in groups of four. Complimentary access, premium benefits, VIP parking, right to first refusal, and access to other premium areas are all a part of the deal. Theater Boxes are another option and accommodate 4-6 or 8-12 guests. In a Suite-like environment, VIP parking, private entrance, all-inclusive food and beverage, access to other areas, and access to adjoining clubs are included. Prices vary for half and full season Box securements. Loge Boxes are another area with private, prestigious, and complimentary amenities. And, for Suites, the Mavericks have you covered. Food and beverage packages, VIP treatment and experiences, fully-equipped meeting rooms, and exclusive access are available.

Past Spotlights

Jason Kidd took over for longtime coach Rick Carlisle last year and promptly led the team to the Western Conference Finals, upsetting the top-seeded Phoenix Suns in the second round to get there. The club is surrounding emerging star Luka Doncic with new players after trading Kristaps Porzingis midway through last year and then parting ways with Jalen Brunson over the summer. Tim Hardaway Jr. returning to health will help, as will the addition of Christian Wood, who starred on a down-trodden Houston team. Dorian Finney-Smith also had career-highs last year in points, assists, and steals and will be looking to add to those numbers.

Suites at the American Airlines Center range in size from 18 to 50 guests, so no matter the occasion, a luxury suite at a Mavericks game will suit your needs and are available on three different levels of the arena. All suites come with customizable food and beverage packages, VIP parking in the Lexus Garage, and access to all Platinum Level clubs and lounges in the arena—so be sure to come to the game early!

Management may have changed, but the expectations remain sky-high in the Lone Star State. Luka Doncic and Kristaps Porzingis lead the way once again as two of the most dynamic and exciting

playmakers in the NBA. Three-point specialist Tim Hardaway Jr. inked a four-year extension to keep the core of this group together, and the additions of Reggie Bullock and Sterling Brown should provide sparks off the bench. A Mavs icon returns to sit at the end of the bench—Jason Kidd replaces Rick Carlisle as head coach of a club that made the playoffs, but was sent home early, in back-to-back years. Kidd most recently served as the head honcho for the Milwaukee Bucks, who made the postseason twice under his wing. American Airlines Arena offers numerous ways to feel as glamorous as team owner Mark Cuban while watching along. Single game or luxury suite leases offer VIP parking in the Lexus Garage as well as private attendant and concierge service. Platinum Premiere provides in-seat service and $30 towards food, beverage, or team merchandise every single time the Mavericks tip-off! Courtside Seating is always a hit with the best views, invitations to exclusive events, and first crack at playoff ticket sales.

Luxury Suite Costs

What determines how much a suite costs?

Suite pricing varies widely based on a number of variables including league, city, team, opponent, time of day, day of week, and suite location.

Day of Week: In general, suites can be slightly more expensive during weekdays (Monday through Thursday) because those days are ideal for corporations to entertain their clients in a suite.

League: NFL suites are the most expensive by because of the limited number of games (8 home games per team).

Suite Location: While just being in a suite is generally seen as the most desirable and luxurious seat in the building, some stadiums and arenas have multiple suite levels. If this is the case, certain clients are willing to pay a premium to be in a lower level suite that is closest to the action on the field. We will give you details on suite location as we provide you with availability for the game you desire.

Does it pay to wait to book a suite until closer to the event?

With regular tickets, prices will often drop in the days leading up to a game. While every once in a while the same occurs with suites, in general, pricing does not drop before the game. In fact, because of the very limited availability of luxury suites, it is advised to book a suite well in advance, as suites are often not available at the last minute. In addition, in coordinating events for larger groups (suites can hold up to 20 guests or more), it is often necessary to give guests a longer lead time to confirm their availability to attend.

Are there additional expenses I should consider?

If you are hosting guests in your suite, consider allocating enough budget to order catering for your suite. Catering is typically not included in the price of the suite. Suite Experience Group clients typically spend between $1,000-$2,000 for catering, with some clients spending even more if they order significant amounts of alcohol.

Are there discounts if I buy multiple games at once?

Some clients purchase multiple suites in multiple venues at one time. Suite Experience Group can provide special package pricing for clients who buy three or more suites at one time.

How can I maximize my budget?

If you are working within a budget and trying to maximize your spend, we would welcome an opportunity to further discuss your goals for the event and the different options available to you. Please call us at 800-592-7043 or fill out this form to get started. We look forward to the opportunity to help you explore your options in renting a luxury suite.
